title: Executive Order 6103-Exemption of Banking Emergency Employes from Civil Service Rules
content: In view of the emergency and temporary nature of appointments in the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, under the provisions of the Act of Congress approved March 9th, 1933 (To provide relief in the existing national emergency in banking, and for other purposes), such appointments may be made without regard to Civil Service requirements.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6103-Exemption of Banking Emergency Employes from Civil Service Rules Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361933
